documents.document: Me: "We're all beautiful on the inside". 6yo: <thinks> "No... On the inside, we're all gross".
@julesdesmond Just heard fan leaving TAB at the railway station asking friends "Where do we go? Where do we go now?" #lyricsforeveryoccasion
@jamesmacfie Is this an old tweet from this time last year? #themorethingschangethemoretheystaythesame
@vangheezy @chrismcdonough <pulls out Michael Crichton quote on the Murray Gell-Mann Amnesia effect> https://t.co/cfYJvNFTlq
@JulieReddish You seen the "Padmé's parents' house" Episode II deleted scene? It's up there with "I don't like sand" https://t.co/4Yv2lHXUvL
@JulieReddish @cheerschopper @dingfelder You must do what you feel is right of course. https://t.co/KXgxJmSebO
@JulieReddish Jump to IV! Jump to IV! @cheerschopper and I were lamenting that Episode I is the "best" of the prequels. #lightsaberoverload
6yo, serving strawberries : "Dad, you only get a small bowl because you've had your time of sweetness."
@gbcrzs Do not expect previous keyboard shortcuts to continue functioning.
@sharkbrain When I checked last night, yes. X3 still closed. @MiniGuineaBakes @brettwilson
@jenobyrne Internet says Croftdon Downs Countdown is open. Khandallah New World is open. Not exactly near Northland though. HTH.
Positive thought: #skateboarding will be doing what it always does - saving disaffected kids' lives - throughout rural USA #skatetrumpshate
@geojay78 @outonbluesix Diana's death. Page 335, FYI.
The knees hurt but the heart is strong as ever. Almost-40yo Andrew Reynolds still makes me wanna go #skateboarding https://t.co/EdDYS6Wu2r
This @lerevedetoiles talk on leading technical people is jam-packed with solid advice whatever your role: https://t.co/wNn3TsRshu #justask
6yo: *takes swig of water; coughs* "Urgh! That went into my breathing section!"
Love hearing the craft behind the song: songwriter Rod Temperton's guide vocal for Michael Jackson on Rock With You https://t.co/euMhYq4lfI
@optilude Excellent, thank you. Breakdown of Scrum by org's values/disciplines/activities vs a person's role might help me solve a problem.
@optilude The values/disciplines/activities model @ https://t.co/W0mqwAfx0B - you still using it? did you base it on an existing framework?
5yo niece:You must never get into a car if a stranger says "Get into my car & have some chocolate" because, well, what if you're dairy free?
BTO nails it: "BA [has improved] #skateboarding’s increasingly tough-to-make case as a sanctuary open to whoever" https://t.co/TGxeVqQa8f
@roddrury Seen this? Daewon explains Instagram motivations and shows his crazy front truck setup. Tonnes of clips. https://t.co/xBt85nwi9J
"Essex"? You're having a laugh mate. And anyway, Essex has "Fingringhoe", which is better than all these. https://t.co/sARkQjc5cb
@JulieReddish 6yo tells me that "girls change their minds a lot" which is why I was a "terrible" cook this morning but a "brilliant" one now
@JulieReddish +1. As a child I decided early on not to let my guard be lowered by these unfunny men in bad disguises...
"I couldn't deduce why she didn't once blink with surprise As fathom by fathom I gradually drowned in her eyes" #wow https://t.co/0U3DiulNFV
That #skateboarding dream where everything floats and all is makeable? Grant Taylor skates like that in real life. https://t.co/Yji8Oeomdh
You know where you are with a go-live blocker: clear priority (this uber alles) and accept crit (can go live without explosion). I like 'em.
@JulieReddish @legenny I am in ur #xerounconference live stream watchin ur well-received ice breaker activity from the UK
@nicshaha A stranger. From the outside. Ooooooo.

6yo: Who's your favourite cousin?
Me: Hmmm. Let's go with... Claire.
6yo: Is she the one in the movie with the three chipmunks?
Me: ???
@thrashermag Can you put the 'best of' Grant Taylor Bru Ray edit on youtube please?
@jojoconstance That's brutal.
Me: "Time for bed my little toucan" 4yo: "*I'm* not a toucan. *You're* a toucan" Me: "Well... toucan play at that game" #parenting #dadjokes

Girls eating breakfast.
6yo: "Let's play British Bake Off. *peers at sister's cereal* Your cornflakes are too hard and your milk's too wet"
@bridgetmartin Silent All These Years live in session at the BBC, 1991: https://t.co/FVuh6f7ANv
Current status: jump starting car after urchins left interior lights on overnight. #xplorewellington #grumpydaddy
4yo: "I love this song so much [Rock the Boat, by Hues Corporation] that it even makes my tummy happy".
Current status: searching the web for photos of Scarlett Johansson as Black Widow for 'work'. Life could get a lot worse. #xplorewellington

Watching (selected bits of) Star Wars. Han & Chewie appear.
4yo: "Hmmm. Chewbacca is very tall. He's a lot taller than Prince Hans".
@bridgetmartin Talking football? Yeah!
Leicester City are champions! So happy for Claudio. What a star.

Me, reading bedtime story: "Every day Cinderella wished for Love".
4yo, frowning: "Well I just wish for a pet seal".
4yo: "Ah, this water tastes fresh... like sausages".
@jenobyrne Feature request: CatThatJumps
@quietcorners Oh I see. "Best bail contest" and all the clips are slams. Barry could win best bail with his steps ollie kickaway technique.
@quietcorners Ha ha, what is this in relation to?
1st post I've seen for a #clojure dev in Wellington. The new wave starts here? (in Lyall Bay appropriately) https://t.co/pbehRw9Gmx @montoux
@bbc606 New podcast from iTunes feed won't download. Also its title is 22/10/2011, which is maybe part of why.
Programming tastefully elided, this video captures life at Xero (even for developers) pretty well https://t.co/cDo7Od7VSC #dobeautifulwork
5yo: Dad, pretend you're my boyfriend. Me: Here're flowers for you darling. 5yo: *screws up face* Just pretend...you've gone to Auckland.
@winston_muller beast mode bro.
@quietcorners Imagine 10 different minis in the same building! You visit yours but your neighbour's 'in' and let's you ride theirs too!
Wear a flat cap. Move at a sedate pace now that you're old. I think I'm onto something big here.
Idea: skate allotments. Pay a sub for a private indoor skate space in a shared building. Subs can be split between friends. Each gets a key.
@TVNZondemand Your app on LG TV via FreeviewPlus often freezes loading adverts. Have to restart TV. Known issue? Any recommended workaround?
@quietcorners Went tonight after this stellar review. Yeah, very good! SFX are ridiculous nowadays. When is a bear not a bear? I dunno.

"What version is your System Xml Daddy Long Legs?"
Doing Windows is funner since I discovered what DLL *really* stands for.
Seem to have gotten something in my eye listening to @themarkrad on Bowie https://t.co/BIUnFscljo
Always loved that Penny shocked #skateboarding in the 90s like Bowie shocked pop in the 70s https://t.co/wqrN5cWWNd https://t.co/Cch1RaR0l6
Quicksand is sooo beautiful #davidbowie https://t.co/fBOLFV9TEj
@jojoconstance You may remember this from the wall of an ex-colleague... https://t.co/QjpMWD7xWC
5yo: Let's have some... boogie! *whispers* That's a French word for 'music'.
@fakeamerican Run DMC's "Christmas in Hollis" FTW
@fakeamerican Dat feel when you figure out where your neighbour went by checking Twitter :-)
@bridgetmartin Am looking for a new ISP. After all your pain, are there any you'd recommend?
TIL (eventually) that "rdebug" as a switch invokes a different debugger than "rdebug" as a command. Sheesh Ruby. https://t.co/1UN4vkUMLV
@Sererena Brilliant talk on that topic: hammock-driven development https://t.co/lQXB5i9R4I
@gbcrzs My money's on "you're still the line I run to" whilst debugging. What was it?
Watched over in the shower room by @andrewtokeley #uneasyfeeling #areyousureyouwannareleaseTHAT https://t.co/FMjtjO4uci
@cheerschopper Keep it flowing. This tune is a belter.
@legenny Don't mind metal but for today's journey home my heart belongs to Earth, Wind & Fire, Cheryl Lynn and Sister Sledge, thanks to you.
Starting to grok the value of #Python coroutines (at last) through @fluentpython and its neat taxi simulator example https://t.co/Yx4NTUtzbw
@quietcorners Think you'll enjoy the excellent bit of Chelmsford reminiscing in this. Starts at 40:40 http://t.co/X4RPGXDovL
2 days off exploring new pastures and enjoying others doing the same. Thanks for organising @JulieReddish @ShortMethods et al. #xplorexero
git commit -am "Add hardcodedReportNamesArgh, in case we need presentation plan B..." #XploreXero #options
@cheerschopper array.js takes no prisoners #IoT
Making a little boatman with @linqpad for #xplorexero http://t.co/mF4ZnxxYtU
@signifynz Pffft. Where's yer @plone 5 tweet?! https://t.co/6ZfUFBbkHl

I wish @magit_emacs v2 still supported git pickaxe search.
*checks GitHub*
Oh, it's back! https://t.co/px2RjfzUO3
*hugs magit v2*
Operation School Holiday Mr Burns Reindeer proceeding to plan. http://t.co/x9hXD7LIi8
@quietcorners is that Gary?
Those lacking humility will be first against the wall. #irony
That moment in the planning meeting when you ask "which numpty did you find to do that?", and the room goes quiet.
In your life's smoothest moment you could *maybe* get to 1% as smooth as Lou Rawls singing The Girl From Ipanema https://t.co/t091qbeYJR
Reading the new @fluentpython book after @ramalhoorg made a fine pitch on @TalkPython podcast. 50% off right now too http://t.co/7nALdwKhf9
@fakeamerican Not a cheese scone person myself but the whanau swears by Picnic in the Botanical Gardens.
@angela_kinzett Second breakfast hobbit-style? Nice! :-P
Wife gave the gift of extended #skateboarding time for Fathers Day. Used it to learn fakie noseblunt yank in. Me happy, she a bit frazzled.
@gbcrzs there's no name because it's a taboo subject
@SKYNZ Excellent customer service from your man William over the phone. Helpful, attentive, friendly - thumbs up.
.@faassen I love how poetry is woven through this: http://t.co/Vqj7BW2Bk2 "A human mind is a Black Forest of diminished modes" etc.
5yo decided to draw herself a computer. Love her work, especially that she appears to be running #emacs M-x butterfly http://t.co/umGAOSC9VS
Life imitating art. "A moving buddy - you don't got one, get one!" http://t.co/FgBflwiU5i
Over on the Father's Day Gifts stand, the perfect way to show you don't appreciate him. http://t.co/q1zRt0mTSa
Oh there's a @ClojureBridgeNZ, excellent. With an event coming up in Auckland this September: http://t.co/qFoVZPQcX5 #girlswhocode #clojure
@crailtap Straight Outta Torrance tee is rad and I want one, but $29 to ship a $22 shirt to NZ hurts me. Can you do one-off postage perhaps?
@github On iPhone (iPhone 4, iOS 7.1.2, Safari), the mobile file finder 404s following a link :-( Could you take a look please?
@aclark4life /me thinks: "Oh, hey, Bethesda... I've heard of that place - that's aclark's town!" http://t.co/At6afUpI4U
@fakeamerican "the next-best thing is to show it to people who've never seen it" https://t.co/kxcxoARWJD
